questions.question: This ancient ruin is considered the cradle of Western civilization and was once the heart of the world's first democracy.
questions.context: The Parthenon dominates this UNESCO World Heritage site, and its construction began in 447 BC under Pericles.

questions.question: Which famous museum houses the Mona Lisa and the Venus de Milo, attracting nearly 10 million visitors annually?
questions.context: Established in 1793, this museum spans over 73,000 square meters and was originally a fortress built in the 12th century.

questions.question: Recognized as a modern architectural marvel, this towering structure once held the title of the world's tallest building.
questions.context: Standing at 828 meters, it opened in 2010 and features a unique triple-lobed footprint design inspired by the Hymenocallis flower.

questions.question: This UNESCO site, recognized for its mudbrick buildings, is considered one of the oldest cities in the Middle East.
questions.context: Once a key center of Islamic culture, its architecture dates back over 2,500 years with influences from various successive civilizations.

questions.question: Known for launching the first human into orbit, what iconic site represents a major milestone in space exploration?
questions.context: Established in 1955, this site witnessed Yuri Gagarin's historic Vostok 1 mission in 1961, marking a pivotal event in the Space Race.
